front.title: A Framework for Semantic IPv6 Prefix

abstract.t: This document describes a framework method that network operations may use their addresses. Network operators, who have large IPv6 address space, may choose to embedded some semantics into IPv6 addresses by assigning additional significance to specific bits within the prefix. By embedded semantics into IPv6 prefixes, the semantics of packets can be inspected easily. Routers and other intermediary devices can easily apply relevant policies as required. Packet-level differentiation can also enable flow-level and user- level differentiation. Consequently, the network operators can accordingly treat network packets differently and efficiently. The management and maintenance of networks can be much simpler.
